title: Understanding the difference between grid-template and grid-auto
content: With all the new properties related to CSS Grid Layout, one of the distinctions that always confused me was the difference between the grid-template-* and grid-auto-* properties. Specifically the difference between grid-template-rows/columns and grid-auto-rows/columns.

title: Recreating the GitHub Contribution Graph with CSS Grid Layout
content: Learn how to recreate GitHub's contribution graph using CSS Grid, making it responsive and visually appealing.

title: Mastering Flexbox: A Guide to Modern CSS Layout
content: Flexbox is a powerful CSS layout module that allows you to design flexible and efficient layouts without using floats or positioning.

title: CSS Grid vs Flexbox: When to Use Which
content: Both CSS Grid and Flexbox are powerful tools for creating layouts, but they excel at different things. Learn when to use each layout system in your designs.

title: Building a Responsive Navbar with CSS Grid
content: Creating a responsive navbar that adapts to different screen sizes is easy with CSS Grid. Follow this guide to learn how to build one.

title: A Deep Dive into CSS Variables
content: CSS Variables, also known as custom properties, allow you to create reusable values across your stylesheets, making your code cleaner and more maintainable.

title: Using CSS Grid for Advanced Layouts
content: CSS Grid allows you to create complex layouts that were previously difficult or impossible with CSS alone. Explore how to build advanced grid layouts in this tutorial.

title: Creating Animations with CSS Keyframes
content: CSS Keyframes enable you to create animations that can add dynamic elements to your website. Learn how to use keyframes to create smooth animations.

title: Introduction to CSS Transitions
content: CSS Transitions allow you to change property values smoothly over a specified duration, making for a more engaging user experience.

title: Exploring the Power of CSS Grid Template Areas
content: CSS Grid Template Areas allow you to define named grid areas and place elements into those areas, making it easy to create well-structured layouts.
